snippet: Twenty-one people were charged Tuesday after the Georgia Bureau of Investigation said it found widespread abuse of patients at a specialized care facility northeast of Atlanta.
abstract: Twenty-one people are charged after Georgia Bureau of Investigation says it found widespread abuse of patients at specialized care facility northeast of Atlanta; bureau says its review had found that employees at Alzheimer’s Care of Commerce had struck patients, delayed changing diapers and used bedsheets as restraining devices.
lead_paragraph: Twenty-one people were charged Tuesday after the Georgia Bureau of Investigation said it found widespread abuse of patients at a specialized care facility northeast of Atlanta.

headline.main: Georgia: 21 Charged After Inquiry Finds Alzheimer’s Patients Were Abused
